page.title: 18GILLING WEST SCHOOL 1985
page.content: {Gilling West C.of E.School}has changed since the 1930s. The number of children in the village has dropped so there is a small number of pupils - {eight juniors and twelve infants. There are{two teachers}-the Head who teaches all day,and a part-time teacher who teaches the juniors in the mornings- and an{ancillary helper. We sit at tables,in groups of four or six to do our lessons.In{Maths.}we work from cards,individually,and we do practical work. As well as{English}and {Hand-writing,}we work on{topics-}like the{Domesday Project.}We play {recorders}and other tuned percussion instruments. We watch school programmes on{television,}and we work through programmes on the{computer. When we are{eleven}years of age we will go to{Richmond Comprehensive.
